intro: Chaenorhinum rubrifolium, commonly known as the red-leaf chaenorhinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
